document.docTitle: Pagurixus ruber Komai & Osawa 2006, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Pagurixus boninensis species group, with descriptions of six new species (Crustacea: Decapoda: Anomura: Paguridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Pagurixus boninensis species group, with descriptions of six new species (Crustacea: Decapoda: Anomura: Paguridae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Natural History Museum and Institute, Chiba, 955 - 2 Aoba-cho, Chuo-ku, Chiba 260 - 8682, Japan.

.—

.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 40.
Pagurixus ruber
n. sp.
A–C, G–I, holotype male (SL 2.4 mm) from Kume­jima Island (CBM­ZC 7862); D–F, paratype male (SL 2.1 mm) from Guam (UF 7305). A, shield and cephalic appendages, dorsal view; B, left antennule, lateral view; C, ultimate segment of left antennular peduncle, ventral view; D, left fourth pereopod, dactylus and propodus, lateral view; E, same, mesial view; F, right fourth pereopod, dactylus and propodus, lateral view; G, sixth thoracic sternite, ventral view; H, coxae of fifth pereopods and eighth thoracic sternite, ventral view; I, telson, dorsal view. Scale bars: 1 mm for A; 0.5 mm for B–I.

,
14 August 2000
, coll. G. Paulay
;
UF 7306 , 7 ovigerous females (SL 1.6–1.9 mm ), Cocos, SW side, outer barrier reef, under rubble,
1–2 m
,
20 August 2000
, coll. G. Paulay.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 41.
Pagurixus ruber
n. sp.
A, C, D, holotype male (SL 2.4 mm) from Kume­jima Island (CBM­ZC 7862); B, E, paratype male (SL 1.5 mm) from Vadoo, Maldives (CBM­ZC 8345). Right cheliped. A, B, chela, dorsal view; C, entire right cheliped, mesial view (carpus damaged); D, same, lateral view; E, carpus, dorsal view. Scale bar: 1 mm.

FIGURE 42.
Pagurixus ruber
n. sp.
Paratype female (SL 2.6 mm) from Amami­oshima Island (CBM­ZC 8485). Right cheliped. A, chela, dorsal view; B, entire right cheliped, mesial view; C, same, lateral view; D, carpus, dorsal view. Scale bar: 0.5 mm.

FIGURE 43.
Pagurixus ruber
n. sp.
Holotype male (SL 2.4 mm) from Kume­jima Island (CBM­ ZC 7862). A, left cheliped, chela and carpus, dorsal view; B, entire left cheliped, mesial view; C, same, lateral view; D, right second pereopod, lateral view; E, left third pereopod, lateral view; F, right second pereopod, dactylus and distal part of propodus, mesial view; G, left third pereopod, dactylus and distal part of propodus, mesial view. Scale bars: 1 mm.

TABLE 3. Comparison among
P. festinus McLaughlin & Haig, 1984
,
P. boninensis ( Melin, 1939 )
,
P. ruber
n. sp.
and
P. paulayi
n. sp.

tr.th: Setal rows of ultimate segment of antennular peduncle
tr.td: consisting of short transverse rows of setae
consisting of mixture of short and moderately short setae

tr.th: Dorsal surface of palm of male right cheliped
Dorsolateral margin of palm of female right cheliped
Ventrolateral margin of merus of right cheliped
tr.td: with 1 or 2 spines followed by row of small tubercles

tr.th: Dorsolateral and dorsomesial margins of carpus of left cheliped
tr.td: each with row of small spines
each with row of very small tubercles or low protuberances
each with row of very small tubercles or low protuberances

tr.th: Right coxae of fifth pereopod in male
tr.td: with very short ventromesial protrusion; tuft of setae well developed, reaching to left coxa
with prominent ventromesial protrusion; tuft of setae well developed, reaching to left coxa
without ventromesial protrusion; tuft composed of some short setae, not reaching to left coxa
with prominent ventromesial protrusion, tuft of setae reaching to left coxa

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 44. A,
Pagurixus maorus ( Nobili, 1906 )
, male (SL 3.9 mm) from Kume­jima Island, Ryukyu Islands, photo taken by M. Osawa; B,
Pagurixus tweediei ( Forest, 1956 )
, male (SL 3.9 mm) from Tahiti, Society Islands, French Polynesia (UF 1731), photo taken by G. Paulay; C,
Pagurixus nomurai Komai & Asakura, 1995
, ovigerous female from Guam, Mariana Islands (UF), photo taken by G. Paulay; D,
Pagurixus concolor
n. sp.
, paratype female (SL 3.2 mm) from Tokashiki Island, Kerama Islands (CBM­ZC 8484), photo taken by M. Osawa.

FIGURE 45. A,
Pagurixus boninensis ( Melin, 1939 )
, ovigerous female (SL 2.7 mm) from Hachijo Island, Izu Islands, Japan (CMNH­ZC 1688), photo taken by J. Okuno; B,
Pagurixus carinimanus
n. sp.
, paratype female (SL 1.6 mm) from Okinawa Island, Ryukyu Islands (CBM­ZC 8481), photo taken by Y. Fujita; C, D,
Pagurixus brachydactylus
n. sp.
, male (SL 2.6 mm) from Chichi­jima Island, Ogasawara Islands, photo taken by M. Osawa.

FIGURE 46. A,
Pagurixus pseliophorus
n. sp.
, paratype male (SL 3.3 mm) from Saga, Kochi Prefecture, Japan (CBM­ZC 8533), photo taken by T. Komai; B,
Pagurixus ruber
n. sp.
, paratype male (SL 2.3 mm) from Izu­oshima Island, Izu Islands, Japan (CMNH­ZC 1873), photo taken by J. Okuno.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ryukyu Islands , Izu Islands , Taiwan , Guam . Society Islands , Tuamotu Archipelago and Maldives ( Fig. 48 ); subtidal to
8 m
.
This new species appears to be widely distributed in the Indo­West Pacific
.

Pagurixus ruber
n. sp.
is very similar to
P. boninensis
and
P. paulayi
n. sp.
Differences among the three species are summarized in Table 3 . In life, this new species is readily recognizable by its coloration; the chelipeds and ambulatory legs are generally purplish red or wine red ( Fig. 46B ).

As discussed before, McLaughlin & Haig’s (1984) male specimens referred to
P. boninensis
most probably represent this new species. During this study, we have examined specimens from Guam , identified by Dr. P. A. McLaughlin as
P. boninensis
. They actually represent
P. ruber
n. sp.
, instead of
P. boninensis
. Therefore, we list the reference of
P. boninensis
from Guam ( Paulay et al., 2003 ) in the synonymy of
P. ruber
n. sp.
, although we have not examined the voucher specimen ( UF 645) identified by Dr. McLaughlin.

From the Latin
ruber
, meaning red, in reference to the characteristic, vivid lifecoloration of the new species.
